p: Consequently, 11 (CTX-treated) and eight (TIM-treated) explants sprouted after 2 weeks of cultivation and reached up about 2â€“3 cm in height after 6 weeks in sprouting media ( Figure 1d,e, Table 1). The sprouted plantlets were transferred to the rooting media with half of the initial antibiotic concentrations. During the rooting phase, fungi colonized on only one plantlet (TIM-treated) ( Table 1). After 8 weeks of cultivation in rooting media, six (CTX-treated) and all the seven (TIM-treated) plantlets rooted ( Table 1). The plantlets in the TIM-treated group tended to grow lush roots with large leaves ( Figure 1g). In the CTX-treated group, however, the plantlets had sparse roots and small leaves ( Figure 1f).
